result.execSummary:
The defendant Derek J Ellis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Business Setting >$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: Repeater, PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Penalty - Theft >$5000-$10,000], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: for the 7/27/21 Sentencing After Revocation Hearing filed by Court Reporter Marjorie Kurtz
Defendant's probation revoked - sentenced to prison on 7-27-21; unpaid restitution of $6,867.50, court obligations of $1,334.15, and supervision fees of $1,779 per notice from DOC
of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed by Atty Riek

9:37 AM Defendant Derek J Ellis appeared in court in custody from the Columbia County Jail, Attorney Amanda K. Riek appeared in court for Derek J Ellis, Attorney Brenda L. Yaskal appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing recommendations argued. Court sentenced the defendant to 1 year initial confinement & 3 years extended supervision. Conditions: Defendant to pay $100.00 per month toward restitution. Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program & Earned Release Program. 290 days credit. Sentence to start forthwith. 10: 01 AM
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 27, 2021 at 09:30 am.
filed by Probation Agent Dori Korfmacher
extending probation for 1 year from 8/4/20 to new discharge date of 8/4/21
Extending Probation filed by DOC

02:35 PM  Defendant Derek J Ellis not in Court. Maura O'Connell Melka appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agent Dori Korfmacher appeared. All parties appeared by video Zoom. State requested the court extend probation given the amount of restitution still unpaid. Discussion was held on why discharge date changed from May to August. Agent stated the defendant was in absconding status for a few months a few times. Court extended probation for 1 year or until restitution is paid in full whichever comes first. 2:47 PM
Notice of Hearing mailed to defendant at 402 W. Conant St. Apt. #2 Portage, WI 53901, returned marked attempted not known, unable to forward.
Probation review hearing on July 21, 2020 at 02:30 pm.
Request for probation review hearing filed by DA Yaskal
Defendant to be discharged from probation on 8-4-20; unpaid restitution of $6,927.50 and court obligations of $1,334.15
